summary:
An official website of the United States government

Here’s how you know

**The .gov means it’s official.**  
Federal government websites often end in .gov or .mil. Before sharing
sensitive information, make sure you're on a federal government site.

**The site is secure.**  
The **https://** ensures that you're connecting to the official website and
that any information you provide is encrypted and sent securely.

Talk to the **Veterans Crisis Line** now

# Glossary of Terms and Abbreviations:

##### F : Formulary Item

This product is on the VA national formulary and may be prescribed for
dispensing from a VA Pharmacy.

##### F-R : Formulary Restricted

This product is on the VA national formulary and has standardized restrictions
such as being limited to a defined subspecialty of prescribers.

See product detail page for additional information.

##### PA-F : Prior Authorization - Facility

This product is on the VA national formulary and may have prior authorization
requirements that are managed at the local facility level.

See product detail page for CFU requirements or contact your local VA pharmacy
for additional instruction on obtaining a prior authorization for this
medication.

##### PA-V : Prior Authorization - VISN

This product is on the VA national formulary and may have prior authorization
requirements that are managed at the VISN (regional) level.

See product detail page for CFU requirements or contact your local VA pharmacy
for additional instruction on obtaining a prior authorization for this
medication.

##### PA-N : Prior Authorization - National

This product is on the VA national formulary and may have prior authorization
requirements that are managed at the national level.

See product detail page for CFU requirements or contact your local VA pharmacy
for additional instruction on obtaining a prior authorization for this
medication.

##### NF : Non-Formulary Item

This product is not on the VA national formulary and requires a non-formulary
drug request and prior approval to be dispensed.

Other formulary alternatives should be considered when clinically appropriate.

##### CFU : Criteria for Use

This term refers to specific inclusion and exclusion criteria and other
clinical requirements for use of a given medication.

##### VISN : Veterans Integrated Service Network

This term refers to each of the 18 regional networks of VA facilities.

##### U/E Formulary : Urgent/Emergent Formulary Item

This term refers to the status of a drug on the VA Urgent/Emergent formulary
listing. Items on the Urgent/Emergent formulary may be filled at outside
pharmacies in some instances under specific provisions for Community Care.

Refer to https://www.va.gov/communitycare for additional information on the
requirements and limitations associated with this benefit.

 __

### We’re here anytime, day or night – 24/7

If you are a Veteran in crisis or concerned about one, connect with our
caring, qualified responders for confidential help. Many of them are Veterans
themselves.

  *  __Call **988 and select 1**
  *  __Text **838255**
  *  __Start a confidential chat
  *  __

For TTY, call **711 then 988**

Get more resources at VeteransCrisisLine.net.
